**Source:** MarkTechPost  
**Link:** [https://www.marktechpost.com/2025/12/28/nvidia-ai-researchers-release-nitrogen-an-open-vision-action-foundation-model-for-generalist-gaming-agents/](https://www.marktechpost.com/2025/12/28/nvidia-ai-researchers-release-nitrogen-an-open-vision-action-foundation-model-for-generalist-gaming-agents/)

HEADLINE: NVIDIA Unveils NitroGen: A Groundbreaking Foundation Model for Gaming AI

SUMMARY: NVIDIA has launched NitroGen, an innovative open vision action foundation model designed for generalist gaming agents. This model learns to play commercial games by analyzing pixels and gamepad actions, trained on an extensive dataset of 40,000 hours of gameplay across over 1,000 games, and includes a universal simulator and an open dataset.

KEY POINTS:
- NitroGen enables AI to learn gaming skills directly from gameplay videos.
- It has been trained on 40,000 hours of diverse gaming content.
- The model is designed to be versatile across various games, enhancing generalist capabilities.
- An open dataset and universal simulator facilitate further research and development in gaming AI.

IMPACT: NitroGen represents a significant advancement in AI gaming technology, paving the way for more sophisticated and adaptable gaming agents, which can enhance gaming experiences and drive innovation in AI applications across the industry.

SUMMARY: Liquid AI has launched LFM2-2.6B-Exp, an experimental language model checkpoint that utilizes pure reinforcement learning to enhance instruction adherence, knowledge tasks, and mathematical capabilities for smaller models. This development aims to optimize performance while ensuring compatibility for on-device and edge deployments.

KEY POINTS:
- LFM2-2.6B-Exp is trained using pure reinforcement learning on top of the existing LFM2 architecture.
- The model targets improvements in instruction following, knowledge tasks, and math capabilities.
- Focused on small 3B class models, it is designed for efficient edge deployment.
- The introduction of dynamic hybrid reasoning aims to enhance model behavior further.

IMPACT: This advancement could significantly improve the usability and performance of AI models in constrained environments, paving the way for more effective applications in mobile and edge computing.
